name: Lake Tahoe Golf Course
description: The South Shore's premier public course, Lake Tahoe Golf Course is a William Bell Jr. design set against 360-degree Sierra Nevada views with the Upper Truckee River winding through its meadow-style layout. An Audubon-certified facility where you're as likely to spot eagles, bears, and beavers as birdies.

faqs.question: When is the course open?
faqs.answer: Lake Tahoe Golf Course is seasonal, typically open May through October depending on weather conditions. Twilight rates are available for afternoon play.

faqs.question: Can I host events at the course?
faqs.answer: Yes. The clubhouse and patio host weddings and events for up to 165 guests with catering, full bar, and stunning mountain backdrops.

faqs.question: How does elevation affect play?
faqs.answer: At 6,260 feet elevation, the ball flies roughly 10% farther than at sea level. Club down and enjoy the extra distance.

bodyText: Since 1959, Lake Tahoe Golf Course has been the South Shore's go-to round — a William Bell Jr. design that plays through grassy mountain meadows with the Upper Truckee River creating natural water hazards and the Sierra Nevada providing a jaw-dropping 360-degree backdrop. As an Audubon-certified facility, the course preserves natural habitats for hawks, eagles, black bears, and beavers that golfers regularly encounter during their rounds. The park-style layout features tree-lined fairways, gentle streams, and strategic ponds that reward thoughtful shot-making over raw power.

tips.content: Club down — at 6,260 feet elevation the ball carries 10% farther
The Upper Truckee River comes into play on several holes — respect the water
Morning rounds are magical with the mountains catching first light

pointOfView: The quintessential South Shore golf experience and a staple of every GTHS Lake Tahoe package. Minutes from Heavenly, Harrah's, and Harvey's — this is where your group plays the day they explore the South Shore. The meadow setting with river views offers a completely different vibe from the mountain courses up in Truckee.

featuredHole.description: A scenic par 4 where the Upper Truckee River guards the right side and mature pines frame the left. The approach to an elevated green with mountain views behind is one of the most photographed shots in Tahoe golf.
